summary: This bill mandates the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) to annually review, update, and report on U.S. government facilities and property deemed sensitive for national security purposes. It amends the Defense Production Act of 1950 to require CFIUS to create a list of sensitive sites, provide regular reports including notices, declarations, reviews, and investigations related to these sites.  Committee members must review facilities within their agencies annually and submit reports recommending updates to the list.  Classified briefings on the list are also provided to members of Congress when requested.
